H0.text: Bohr model is a model describing atomic structure that is often referred to as a planetary model.

H1.text: Newton's model is the planetary model often used to describe atomic structure.

H2.text: The kinetic model is the model describing atomic structure that is often referred to as a planetary model.

H3.text: The Pascal model is often referred to as a planetary model describing atomic structure.

A4.text: It is analogous to the structure of the Solar System, but with attraction provided by electrostatic force rather than gravity, and with the electron energies quantized (assuming only discrete values).
